title: Boat's earth
fullText:
Connection to the general mass of the hull of the boat, or to an earth plate complying with Clause 8.2, in such a manner as will ensure at all times an immediate discharge of electrical energy without danger.
NOTE: A conductor is said to be 'solidly earthed' when it is electrically connected to the hull or earth plate without a fuselink, switch, circuit-breaker, resistor, or impedance in the earth connection.
